The property is a comma-separated list of shadows, each specified by 2-4 length values.
The color of the shadow. The default value is black.
Sets this property to its default value.
Some CSS properties are animatable, meaning that they can be used in animations and transitions.
Animatable properties can change gradually from one value to another, like size, numbers, percentage and color.
The numbers in the table specifies the first browser version that fully support CSS animations.
W3Schools' Browser support reference is tested regularly with all major browsers.
The border-top-right-radius property defines the shape of the border of the top-right corner.
This property allow you to add rounded borders to elements!
